result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Rebecca L Brasfield was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty but Not Guilty Due to Mental Disease/Defect

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rebecca L Brasfield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order of Discharge upon Expiration of Commitment, filed and signed by the Court.  The Court orders the discharge of the commitment on March 21, 2016.  Copies forwarded to parties.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Invoice forwarded to accounts payable in the amount of $781.25 to Dr John Pankiwicz for service on 07-12-2015,07-14-2015,07-15-2015,07-16-2015.Copy in file.

Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Parties agree with conditional release plan dated 9/21/2015.  Court adopts the plan and orders the defendant the defendant committed to DHS.  Court orders conditional release, subject to the plan approved by the court; orders signed, filed and distributed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant changes her plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

PHASE II:  
Parties stipulate to Dr. Pankiewicz's credentials.  Court finds the doctor is in expert.  Sworn for defense:  Dr. John Pankiewicz.  State calls no witnesses.  Defense makes argument.  Based on the July 26, 2015 report and the testimony of Dr. Pankiewicz, Court finds the defendant fits the criteria for a special plea and finds the defendant not guilty by mental defect.  Court ordered the defendant to take all prescribed medications and reiterated the no contact order.  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for return on doctor's report.  Parties reviewed report.  The State challenges the report.  Defense counsel advised the Court that the defendant is requesting a court trial.  Court had colloquy with the defendant about waiving her right to a trial.  Court finds the defendant knowingly and intelligently waives her right to a jury trial.  Case adjourned for court trial in Branch 24.  Court trial scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense counsel entered a plea of not guilty by reason of mental disease /defect.  Court ordered defendant to be examined by Dr. Pankiewicz; order signed and filed.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Program report dated June 12, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered the stayed bench warrant canceled.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant does not appear.  Telephone call received from Milwaukee County Mental Health facility.  Defendant was admitted for inpatient treatment.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued, but stayed issuance of bench warrant until next court date.  Telephone made to Attorney Leah Thomas to inform her of her client's inpatient status and to scheduled a court date.  Attorney Thomas not in office.  Message left with her assistant regarding the developments and the next court date.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Vakesha R.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in court with attorney Eric M. Vega.  Defendant Rebecca L Brasfield in custody.  
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
